key_points: Lawmakers have condemned the violence during the Capitol riot, while some referred to the rioters as "patriots".
The riot was emboldened by President Donald Trump and Republican rally attendees, including state lawmakers.
One GOP state lawmaker has resigned after attending the rally before the riot.
The rally supported Trump's efforts to overturn the 2020 election results and was attended by Republican lawmakers.
Rioters organized an attempted coup, storming the Capitol building during the certification of the election results.
Investigations into the riot are ongoing; at least five people, including one police officer, died during the event.
Members of the Proud Boys, classified as a hate group, were reportedly present at the riot.
A Senate aide secured the electoral vote boxes during the riot, ensuring they were not damaged.
Despite the riot, the vote to certify President-elect Joe Biden proceeded hours later, and Trump promised an orderly transition.
Calls for Trump's impeachment on charges of "incitement of an insurrection" have emerged, as well as backlash against Republican lawmakers at the rally.
